class.name: WireMaterial4D
class.description: WireMaterial4D is a material for 4D wireframe meshes. It provides a user-friendly way to color wireframes using single colors, per-vertex colors, or per-edge colors. WireMaterial4D can be set on a [WireMesh4D] resource to define how the wireframe should be colored, and/or overridden on a specific [MeshInstance4D] node.

members.member: The single albedo color of the material. When the albedo source is set to [constant WIRE_COLOR_SOURCE_SINGLE_COLOR], this is the color of the entire wireframe. If the albedo source is set to [constant WIRE_COLOR_SOURCE_PER_VERT_AND_SINGLE] or [constant WIRE_COLOR_SOURCE_PER_EDGE_AND_SINGLE], this color is multiplied with the per-vertex or per-edge colors, respectively.

The albedo color array of the material. This may be used to color various parts of the mesh, depending on the albedo source flags. Only used when any of the per-item color flags are set, meaning the [constant WIRE_COLOR_SOURCE_PER_VERT_ONLY], [constant WIRE_COLOR_SOURCE_PER_EDGE_ONLY], [constant WIRE_COLOR_SOURCE_PER_VERT_AND_SINGLE], and
The albedo source of the material, an enum specific to wireframes. Can be a single color, per-vertex, per-edge, or a combination of single color and per-vertex/per-edge colors.
The thickness of the wireframe lines in pixels.

constants.constant: Indicates the color source is a single color for the entire wireframe mesh.
Indicates the color source is the color array where each item is used for a vertex.
Indicates the color source is the color array where each item is used for an edge.
Indicates the color source is the color array where each item is used for a vertex, modulated by a single color.
Indicates the color source is the color array where each item is used for an edge, modulated by a single color.
